title: Is it possible to have Handoffs/Agents beta on TS ?
body:
I’m really enjoying this beta version, but it’s a bit limiting that it’s only available in Python. Could you possibly provide an API endpoint? This would allow for manual integration with other programming environments.
https://docs.mistral.ai/agents/handoffs/

title: Module  "@mistralai/mistralai" has no exported member responseFormatFromZodSchema
body:
I'm encountering an import error when trying to follow the [bbox annotations documentation](https://docs.mistral.ai/capabilities/OCR/annotations/#bbox-annotation). The `responseFormatFromZodSchema` function appears to be missing from the exported members of the @mistralai/mistralai package.

# To Reproduce
```ts
import { Mistral } from "@mistralai/mistralai";
import { responseFormatFromZodSchema } from "@mistralai/mistralai";
```

Package Version: `@mistralai/mistralai@1.6.1`

title: Make it treeshakeable
body:
Hi Mistral

This page is published in a way that esbuild is not able to treeshake code:

Gives a bundle that is 1 Megabyte! Not good for serverless and alike.

```
$ npx esbuild index.ts --bundle --platform=node --format=esm --outfile=out.js --minify --analyze
```

```ts
import { Mistral } from "@mistralai/mistralai";

const apiKey = process.env.MISTRAL_API_KEY;
const client = new Mistral({ apiKey: apiKey });

const ocrResponse = await client.ocr.process({
  model: "mistral-ocr-latest",
  document: {
    type: "image_url",
    imageUrl:
      "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mistralai/cookbook/refs/heads/main/mistral/ocr/receipt.png",
  },
});

console.log(ocrResponse);
```

title: TypeScript SDK missing "/v1/ocr" as a valid endpoint type for batch jobs
body:
I'm encountering a TypeScript error while trying to use Mistral's batch API for OCR processing in my Next.js application. According to the official Python SDK examples, the correct endpoint for OCR batch processing is /v1/ocr, but the TypeScript SDK's type definition doesn't include this endpoint.
I'd really appreciate your help with this issue as I'm trying to implement batch OCR processing in my TypeScript application, following the official Python examples.
Environment and Dependency Information
Mistral AI SDK Version: @mistralai/mistralai v1.5.2
TypeScript Version: v5.x
Node.js Environment: Next.js 15.2.1
React Version: 19.0.0

Error message
`Cannot assign type ""/v1/ocr"" to type "ApiEndpoint". ts(2322)`

From type definition:
`type ApiEndpoint = Unrecognized<string> | "/v1/chat/completions" | "/v1/embeddings" | "/v1/fim/completions" | "/v1/moderations" | "/v1/chat/moderations"`

Working Python code example
`created_job = client.batch.jobs.create(
    input_files=[batch_data.id],
    model=ocr_model,
    endpoint="/v1/ocr",
    metadata={"job_type": "testing"}
)`

My TypeScript implementation
`const createdJob = await client.batch.jobs.create({`
`  inputFiles: [batchData.id],`
`  model: "mistral-ocr-latest",`
`  endpoint: "/v1/ocr", `
`  metadata: { job_type: "image_ocr" },`
`});`

The TypeScript SDK doesn't recognize /v1/ocr as a valid endpoint despite it working in the Python version.
Could you please add /v1/ocr to the ApiEndpoint type definition in the TypeScript SDK? Alternatively, if there's a recommended workaround that maintains type safety, I'd be grateful to learn about it.
I've checked the official documentation and examples, and it seems the OCR endpoint is supported in the Python SDK but not properly typed in the TypeScript version.
Thank you for your time and assistance!

title: chore(deps): bump esbuild and tsx in /examples

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: javascript
labels.description: Pull requests that update javascript code

body:
Bumps [esbuild](https://github.com/evanw/esbuild) to 0.25.0 and updates ancestor dependency [tsx](https://github.com/privatenumber/tsx). These dependencies need to be updated together. Updates `esbuild` from 0.23.1 to 0.25.0
Release notes

Sourced from esbuild's releases.

v0.25.0

This release deliberately contains backwards-incompatible changes. To avoid automatically picking up releases like this, you should either be pinning the exact version of esbuild in your package.json file (recommended) or be using a version range syntax that only accepts patch upgrades such as ^0.24.0 or ~0.24.0. See npm's documentation about semver for more information.

  • Restrict access to esbuild's development server (GHSA-67mh-4wv8-2f99)

    This change addresses esbuild's first security vulnerability report. Previously esbuild set the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header to * to allow esbuild's development server to be flexible in how it's used for development. However, this allows the websites you visit to make HTTP requests to esbuild's local development server, which gives read-only access to your source code if the website were to fetch your source code's specific URL. You can read more information in the report.

    Starting with this release, CORS will now be disabled, and requests will now be denied if the host does not match the one provided to --serve=. The default host is 0.0.0.0, which refers to all of the IP addresses that represent the local machine (e.g. both 127.0.0.1 and 192.168.0.1). If you want to customize anything about esbuild's development server, you can put a proxy in front of esbuild and modify the incoming and/or outgoing requests.

    In addition, the serve() API call has been changed to return an array of hosts instead of a single host string. This makes it possible to determine all of the hosts that esbuild's development server will accept.

    Thanks to @​sapphi-red for reporting this issue.

  • Delete output files when a build fails in watch mode (#3643)

    It has been requested for esbuild to delete files when a build fails in watch mode. Previously esbuild left the old files in place, which could cause people to not immediately realize that the most recent build failed. With this release, esbuild will now delete all output files if a rebuild fails. Fixing the build error and triggering another rebuild will restore all output files again.

  • Fix correctness issues with the CSS nesting transform (#3620, #3877, #3933, #3997, #4005, #4037, #4038)

    This release fixes the following problems:

    • Naive expansion of CSS nesting can result in an exponential blow-up of generated CSS if each nesting level has multiple selectors. Previously esbuild sometimes collapsed individual nesting levels using :is() to limit expansion. However, this collapsing wasn't correct in some cases, so it has been removed to fix correctness issues.

      /* Original code */
.parent {
  > .a,
  > .b1 > .b2 {
    color: red;
  }
}

      /* Old output (with --supported:nesting=false) */
      
.parent > :is(.a, .b1 > .b2) {
      
color: red;
      
}
      

      /* New output (with --supported:nesting=false) */
      
.parent > .a,
      
.parent > .b1 > .b2 {
      
color: red;
      
}

      Thanks to @​tim-we for working on a fix.

    • The & CSS nesting selector can be repeated multiple times to increase CSS specificity. Previously esbuild ignored this possibility and incorrectly considered && to have the same specificity as &. With this release, this should now work correctly:

      /* Original code (color should be red) */

... (truncated)

Changelog

Sourced from esbuild's changelog.

Changelog: 2024

This changelog documents all esbuild versions published in the year 2024 (versions 0.19.12 through 0.24.2).

0.24.2

  • Fix regression with --define and import.meta (#4010, #4012, #4013)

    The previous change in version 0.24.1 to use a more expression-like parser for define values to allow quoted property names introduced a regression that removed the ability to use --define:import.meta=.... Even though import is normally a keyword that can't be used as an identifier, ES modules special-case the import.meta expression to behave like an identifier anyway. This change fixes the regression.

    This fix was contributed by @​sapphi-red.

0.24.1

  • Allow es2024 as a target in tsconfig.json (#4004)

    TypeScript recently added es2024 as a compilation target, so esbuild now supports this in the target field of tsconfig.json files, such as in the following configuration file:

    {
  "compilerOptions": {
    "target": "ES2024"
  }
}

    As a reminder, the only thing that esbuild uses this field for is determining whether or not to use legacy TypeScript behavior for class fields. You can read more in the documentation.

    This fix was contributed by @​billyjanitsch.

  • Allow automatic semicolon insertion after get/set

    This change fixes a grammar bug in the parser that incorrectly treated the following code as a syntax error:

    class Foo {
  get
  *x() {}
  set
  *y() {}
}

    The above code will be considered valid starting with this release. This change to esbuild follows a similar change to TypeScript which will allow this syntax starting with TypeScript 5.7.

  • Allow quoted property names in --define and --pure (#4008)

    The define and pure API options now accept identifier expressions containing quoted property names. Previously all identifiers in the identifier expression had to be bare identifiers. This change now makes --define and --pure consistent with --global-name, which already supported quoted property names. For example, the following is now possible:

... (truncated)

title: Revert "chore: disable MCP server generation (#78)"
body:
This reverts commit 502363c5cde590867d94cd7fe19f71324c5bc4f2.

Reason: We're pinning the Speakeasy version for the incoming release.

title: `json_schema` response format parameters are unclear
body:
The native type of `jsonSchema` does not bring much information, same for https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/blob/3324d3bf417df58b0b58d691d492c0b170a6af90/docs/models/components/jsonschema.md .

After search I understood you were expecting a definition structure like into:
https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/blob/3324d3bf417df58b0b58d691d492c0b170a6af90/tests/extra/structChat.test.ts#L37-L61

It would help people I think to mention this explicitly through comments on types, or in the main documentation (maybe I missed something?).

Also it's interesting you are using https://www.npmjs.com/package/zod-to-json-schema . Since I do use `zod` too, I think it's also valuable to mention it to not fight trying to do by hand the standard definition.

Thank you,

EDIT: after digging more I also found `responseFormatFromZodObject()` is exported, it can be used from `@mistralai/mistralai/extra/structChat` like `responseFormat: responseFormatFromZodObject(z.object({ ... }))`

title: Why does the SDK convert things to `camelCase`?
body:
I'm working on an integration of multiple AI services. Some are compatible with Claude's SDK, some with OpenAI's SDK, and some - like Mistral AI - have their own SDK.

For reasons I don't understand, this SDK coerces `snake_case` properties to `camelCase`. I suspect whoever made that decision thought "this will make the SDK look nicer" and didn't realize they were breaking compatibility with code written against conventional SDKs.

My two questions are:
- why?
- can we fix it?

My suggestions are:
- release a major version where the `camelCase` garbage is scrapped
- add a parameter to make the SDK follow conventions

Someone could make the argument "this is a different SDK, and it can have its own conventions". My counterargument here is that it literally _does_ follow the standard conventions if we just simply get rid of this `camelCase` thing; code written to work with OpenAI's SDK will suddenly work with Mistral's SDK without any changes.

title: Error Extra inputs are not permitted on body.safe_prompt
body:
Hello, I'm upgrading the client-ts dependency on my project from 0.5.0 to 1.3.5 and after some code changes to chat.stream usage I get this error using a dedicated ai server:

`'type': 'extra_forbidden', 'loc': ('body', 'safe_prompt'), 'msg': 'Extra inputs are not permitted'`

It seems that the typescript client is sending always safe_prompt parameter, **how can I prevent the client to add 'safe_prompt' to the body ?**

As far as I see in Mistral platform documentation it should be optionnal to have 'safe_prompt' in requests.

If you need more information, the code is open source and here https://github.com/OpenCTI-Platform/opencti/pull/9482

> [!IMPORTANT]
> Linting report available at: <https://app.speakeasy.com/org/mistral-dev/mistral-dev/linting-report/a098d7534552d32d0cc12ea430951c8b>
> OpenAPI Change report available at: <https://app.speakeasy.com/org/mistral-dev/mistral-dev/changes-report/0e65e0244cd9d0078ff15d16b415d2f2>
# SDK update
Based on:
- OpenAPI Doc  
- Speakeasy CLI 1.438.1 (2.457.2) https://github.com/speakeasy-api/speakeasy
## OpenAPI Change Summary


```
└─┬Components
  ├──[➕] schemas (2816:13)
  ├─┬ContentChunk
  │ ├──[➕] oneOf (2796:13)
  │ ├──Discriminator
  │ └─┬ONEOF
  │   └──[🔀] $ref (2817:17)❌ 
  └─┬ToolMessage
    └─┬content
      ├──[➖] type (2918:27)❌ 
      ├──[➕] anyOf (2941:27)
      ├──[➕] anyOf (2939:27)
      └──[➕] anyOf (2940:27)
```

| Document Element | Total Changes | Breaking Changes |
|------------------|---------------|------------------|
| components       | 8             | 2                |



## TYPESCRIPT CHANGELOG
## core: 3.18.3 - 2024-10-31
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- Prevent panic with invalid implicit discriminator mappings with propertyName within allOf object *(commit by [@bflad](https://github.com/bflad))*



## core: 3.18.2 - 2024-09-30
### :wrench: Chores
- switch to ast.Arguments in TS SDKs *(commit by [@disintegrator](https://github.com/disintegrator))*



## core: 3.18.1 - 2024-09-27
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- update readme formatting *(commit by [@adaam2](https://github.com/adaam2))*



## core: 3.18.0 - 2024-09-25
### :bee: New Features
- add support for custom index.ts exports *(commit by [@adaam2](https://github.com/adaam2))*



## core: 3.17.8 - 2024-09-25
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- update readme generation to replace welcome to new sdk section with new markdown notice *(commit by [@adaam2](https://github.com/adaam2))*



## core: 3.17.7 - 2024-09-25
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- fixes to missing examples and improvements to number examples *(commit by [@tristanspeakeasy](https://github.com/tristanspeakeasy))*



## core: 3.17.6 - 2024-09-19
### :wrench: Chores
- remove unnecessary '$' suffixes in TS funcs *(commit by [@disintegrator](https://github.com/disintegrator))*



## core: 3.17.5 - 2024-09-18
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- fixed handling of pre calculated examples *(commit by [@tristanspeakeasy](https://github.com/tristanspeakeasy))*



## core: 3.17.4 - 2024-09-17
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- restore ability to pass Node.js `Buffer` values in file upload operations *(commit by [@disintegrator](https://github.com/disintegrator))*



## core: 3.17.3 - 2024-09-13
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- incorrect usage of nodejs types *(commit by [@tristanspeakeasy](https://github.com/tristanspeakeasy))*



## core: 3.17.2 - 2024-09-11
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- switch from `prepare` to `prepublishOnly` script in `package.json` *(commit by [@disintegrator](https://github.com/disintegrator))*



## core: 3.17.1 - 2024-09-10
### :wrench: Chores
- sort sub-sdks in readme *(commit by [@ThomasRooney](https://github.com/ThomasRooney))*



## core: 3.17.0 - 2024-09-08
### :bee: New Features
- format code with dprint *(commit by [@disintegrator](https://github.com/disintegrator))*



## core: 3.16.4 - 2024-09-06
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- add __tests__ to .gitignore and .npmignore *(commit by [@disintegrator](https://github.com/disintegrator))*



## core: 3.16.3 - 2024-09-06
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- remove erroneous optional marker in envSchema *(commit by [@disintegrator](https://github.com/disintegrator))*



## core: 3.16.2 - 2024-09-05
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- ensure generated examples are stable generation to generation *(commit by [@tristanspeakeasy](https://github.com/tristanspeakeasy))*



## core: 3.16.1 - 2024-09-04
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- ensure test helper methods are only included when needed *(commit by [@tristanspeakeasy](https://github.com/tristanspeakeasy))*



## core: 3.16.0 - 2024-09-03
### :bee: New Features
- support custom compile commands in typescript *(commit by [@disintegrator](https://github.com/disintegrator))*



## core: 3.14.2 - 2024-08-30
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- avoid unused Params import in config.ts *(commit by [@disintegrator](https://github.com/disintegrator))*



## core: 3.14.1 - 2024-08-17
### :wrench: Chores
- remove unused method param *(commit by [@adaam2](https://github.com/adaam2))*



## core: 3.15.0 - 2024-08-16
### :bee: New Features
- add support for uploadStreams (including test generation) *(commit by [@adaam2](https://github.com/adaam2))*



## core: 3.13.2 - 2024-08-13
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- fixed speakeasy.com links and utm_source *(commit by [@tristanspeakeasy](https://github.com/tristanspeakeasy))*



## core: 3.14.0 - 2024-08-09
### :bee: New Features
- default debug logging *(commit by [@ryan-timothy-albert](https://github.com/ryan-timothy-albert))*



## core: 3.13.1 - 2024-08-09
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- fixed output of SDKValidationErrors in tests *(commit by [@tristanspeakeasy](https://github.com/tristanspeakeasy))*



## core: 3.13.0 - 2024-08-08
### :bee: New Features
- debug logging interface *(commit by [@ryan-timothy-albert](https://github.com/ryan-timothy-albert))*



## core: 3.12.3 - 2024-08-08
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- add missing comma in field remaps *(commit by [@disintegrator](https://github.com/disintegrator))*



## core: 3.12.2 - 2024-08-07
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- add core module to gitignore *(commit by [@disintegrator](https://github.com/disintegrator))*



## core: 3.12.1 - 2024-08-06
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- add funcs/ to gitignore *(commit by [@disintegrator](https://github.com/disintegrator))*



## core: 3.12.0 - 2024-08-05
### :bee: New Features
- introduce standalone SDK function to help users build leaner application *(commit by [@disintegrator](https://github.com/disintegrator))*



## core: 3.11.13 - 2024-08-02
### :wrench: Chores
- refactor sdk base class to reduce boilerplate *(commit by [@disintegrator](https://github.com/disintegrator))*



## core: 3.11.12 - 2024-08-01
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- language specific env var wrapping *(commit by [@ThomasRooney](https://github.com/ThomasRooney))*



## core: 3.11.11 - 2024-07-29
### :wrench: Chores
- reduce security boilerplate in SDK methods *(commit by [@disintegrator](https://github.com/disintegrator))*



## core: 3.11.10 - 2024-07-23
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- avoid injecting empty 2xx sub-response if `default` status code is available and considered succesful *(commit by [@disintegrator](https://github.com/disintegrator))*



## core: 3.11.9 - 2024-07-23
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- fixed usage snippet generation not showing examples for oneOf/anyOf schemas *(commit by [@tristanspeakeasy](https://github.com/tristanspeakeasy))*



## core: 3.11.8 - 2024-07-22
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- handling of renamed object fields using x-speakeasy-name-override *(commit by [@tristanspeakeasy](https://github.com/tristanspeakeasy))*



## core: 3.11.7 - 2024-07-16
### :wrench: Chores
- add CONTRIBUTING.md generation if file doesn't exist *(commit by [@tristanspeakeasy](https://github.com/tristanspeakeasy))*



## core: 3.11.6 - 2024-07-09
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- Use 0666 file mode for writing configuration and lock files *(commit by [@bflad](https://github.com/bflad))*



## core: 3.11.5 - 2024-07-05
### :wrench: Chores
- refactor zod schemas for better tree-shaking *(commit by [@disintegrator](https://github.com/disintegrator))*



## core: 3.11.3 - 2024-07-04
### :bug: Bug Fixes
- avoid setting user agent header in browsers *(commit by [@disintegrator](https://github.com/disintegrator))*





Version Bump Type: [patch] - 🤖 (automated)

title: Is there an example of streaming a response from multiple statements (like in a chat)
Need to create and ErrorResponse Type.
Function calling
body:
Hi all, can someone provide an example of a simple tool function call? 

The [current example](https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/blob/main/examples/src/async_function_calling.ts) provided doesn't work, even after adjusting the code. It returns various errors, including that you must pass either messages or tools to the assistant, but not both. Passing only one of them doesn't work either.

Any ideas? Thanks!! ❤️

title: Zod parsing error on DONE token
body:
It seems that Zod struggles to parse API responses at times.

``` Unexpected token 'D', \"[DONE]\" is not valid JSON",```
I've only stumbled across this in our server logs and have not been able to properly reproduce this error.

Has anyone else come across this?

----

client
```
      const mistral = new Mistral({ apiKey: apiKey, serverURL: customBaseURL });

      const result = await mistral.chat.stream({
        model,
        messages: messages as MistralMessage[],
        maxTokens,
      });
```

error

```
 {
    "code": "custom",
    "message": "malformed json: SyntaxError: Unexpected token 'D', \"[DONE]\" is not valid JSON",
    "path": [
      "data"
    ]
  }
]
ZodError: [
  {
    "code": "custom",
    "message": "malformed json: SyntaxError: Unexpected token 'D', \"[DONE]\" is not valid JSON",
    "path": [
      "data"
    ]
  }
]
    at get error [as error] (/usr/src/app/apps/someApp/dist/index.js:36801:27)
    at _ZodObject.parse (/usr/src/app/apps/someApp/dist/index.js:36905:22)
    at decoder (/usr/src/app/apps/someApp/dist/index.js:48267:27)
    at parseEvent (/usr/src/app/apps/someApp/dist/index.js:41444:14)
    at [Symbol.asyncIterator] (/usr/src/app/apps/someApp/dist/index.js:41341:29)
    at process.processTicksAndRejections (node:internal/process/task_queues:95:5)
    at async Object.start (/usr/src/app/apps/someApp/dist/index.js:56920:26)
```

title: Request: Add abort method on chat completion stream
"trainingSteps" hyperparameter is being ignored
Use spec with tag main for generation
body: This PR makes the workflow target the latest spec with the main tag for code generation

title: Request: Export Types for API Parameters and Responses
body:
Hi Mistral SDK team (@GaspardBT)! 👋

Would you consider exporting the internal types used in the SDK, such as those for API parameters and responses, in a future release?

I’m trying to improve support for Mistral in [promptfoo](https://github.com/promptfoo/promptfoo). Currently, we’re making API calls via HTTP (you can see our setup [here](https://github.com/promptfoo/promptfoo/blob/main/src/providers/mistral.ts)), but I'd love to use your SDK, especially for  models like Pixtral.

Thanks for your consideration, and keep up the great work! 🚀

title: Add vision example
body: This PR adds a example to send a request to a vision model

title: Fix streaming response with empty content
body:
This PR updates the client to accepts "content": null when returning tool call in streaming
Files of interest:
- [azure](https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/compare/gaspardBT/fix-stream-empty-content?expand=1#diff-7a39b92d05e2068cb7478fb59c764a8e978e94aa536dcee55cf37497f1281219)
- [gcp](https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/compare/gaspardBT/fix-stream-empty-content?expand=1#diff-13d31310ea185bf4440428a166db120e53cc68a780eaec53d0c6e6d273a48df4)
- [laPlateforme](https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/compare/gaspardBT/fix-stream-empty-content?expand=1#diff-998ce21e890a374b5a13c833fdc3e9a84293b4c33c2d68b1bb0da887576af9f7)

And an extra example for function calling with streaming [here](https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/compare/gaspardBT/fix-stream-empty-content?expand=1#diff-b76f3ac8d0d33e1ee1c1fc066a3c797cad9e8c196d9431bc590af36062dbf40a)

fixes https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/issues/13

title: Fix agent stream and tool type
body:
Fixes https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/issues/14 https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/issues/13
This PR updates the clients to fix and issue with:
- `AgentsCompletionStreamRequest`, which wasn't properly defined https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/issues/14
- The tool type wasn't properly managed https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/issues/13

title: `AgentsCompletionStreamRequest` seems wrong?
body:
Hi 👋

I'm trying to discover the `Agents` and use them with the API. 
The [AgentsCompletionRequest](https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/blob/main/src/models/components/agentscompletionrequest.ts) works fine. The thing is I want to use the stream response and it seems that [AgentsCompletionStreamRequest](https://github.com/mistralai/client-ts/blob/main/src/models/components/agentscompletionstreamrequest.ts) doesn't have the required types / is not updated.

Indeed, there is missing some mandatory information (I think) such as:
- `agentId`
- `messages`

And some others that aren't necessary: 
- `model`
- `prompt`

Since I'm new on this, I might make some mistakes. Feel free to tell me!

title: Zod validation errors when using streaming with functions/tools
body:
Started getting this error after the upgrade (after fixing any breaking changes I could identify):

title: fix: prevent exceptions in custom hooks code
body: This PR contains two sets of fixes for the custom hooks in the SDK. There are a couple of latent bugs in these, one of which prevents using the SDK in Chrome.

title: Missing type exports and migration guide for v1
body: It seems that many of the previously exported types are now comparatively internal, making it harder to refer to them. A migration document similar to the Python client would be helpful here, or otherwise provide exports for the inner types as well.
